description:
RIGHT IN YOUR TERMINAL!

Okay look,
You can get the weather
Right
In
Your
Terminal

Cons:
Can't set my default location, and the location it gets from my IP is incorrect because CG-NAT.

Pros:
IT IS THE WEATHER AND IT IS RIGHT IN YOUR TERMINAL I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH
summary: It's the weather right in your terminal

description:
Really? I have to type
weather-cli --scale=Fahrenheit
rather than simply
weather-cli -f
or echo "scale=Fahrenheit" > ~/.weather-cli
Nobody gives degrees F to 2 decimal places. Just use the integer part.
Current temp 82.02 F, feels like 89.37F - you have to be kidding.
Current temp 82, feels like 89 is all you have to say
summary: -sF and -sf and -f and -F should be recognized options
